physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The abdomen was soft, nontender, and nondistended, with normal bowel sounds. Rectal examination revealed guaiac-positive, brown stool; the remainder of the examination was normal.
Rectal examination revealed soft, guaiac-positive stool with mucus; the remainder of the examination was normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The frequency of emesis had decreased, and stools had occasionally contained mucus but no blood.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The remainder of the physical examination was normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient had had several episodes of small-volume emesis containing dark-brown material resembling blood.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The frequency of emesis had increased, as he had been vomiting formula after approximately 75% of feedings.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The abdomen was soft, with normal bowel sounds and without distention or tenderness. Rectal examination revealed guaiac-negative stool. The remainder of the examination was normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient had continued to gain weight and had had no complications after introducing soft foods, without visible blood in the vomitus or stools.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The examination revealed that the patient appeared well.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The frequency of vomiting had increased since the last visit.
